pageContext.claim: “Out of the billions of dollars that we're taking in, a small portion of that will be going to our farmers because China will be retaliating, probably, to a certain extent, against our farmers. We're going to take the highest year, the biggest purchase that China has ever made with our farmers, which is about $15 billion, and do something reciprocal to our farmers so our farmers can do well.”
pageContext.analysis: China purchased nearly $20 billion in agricultural products from U.S. farmers in 2017, but purchases fell sharply because of Trump's tariffs. The actual record was significantly higher -- $29.6 billion in the 2014 fiscal year, according to the Department of Agriculture.
